intro: Lechea stellata, commonly known as the star-leaved mallow, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves, which are often hairy and have a velvety texture. The plant produces showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It is native to regions of South America, particularly in countries like Argentina and Chile. Lechea stellata is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
